title: Purposefully inting players
body:
I wish to report a duo that purposefully plays bad matches so they can get to Iron 4. I didn't take any screenshots and I don't want to call out since it's against the rules, but could some mods take the case in consideration faster since they're pretty much destroying the game for everyone else.
What's the worst experience you ever had? Besides personal toxicity :'(

replies.body:
There's nothing the mods can do about that. They aren't Riot employees. All they do is moderate Boards.

Also, you don't have to say "purposefully." The word "inting" means "intentionally feeding," which means trying to lose by giving the enemy team kills on purpose. Fun fact: back in the day, it just used to be called "feeding."

Here's a post of mine from 8 months ago.

> [{quoted}](name=TrulyBland,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=mQaA3Wte,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2019-05-28T09:10:10.503+0000)
>
> Called it quite a while ago. "Inting" is going through the same transition as "feeding". Soon people will differentiate between "inting" and "intentionally inting".
> One can only hope that this ridiculous cycle continues and it eventually gets shortened to int-inting (which, in time, will turn into intentionally int-inting).
> 
> Alternatively I propose saying "purposefully inting" and shortening it to "purping".

Did I win something?

> [{quoted}](name=TrulyBland,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=PLJ99ylo,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2020-01-26T04:43:07.502+0000)
>
> Here's a post of mine from 8 months ago.
> 
> Did I win something?

Me, 15 months ago:

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=yrc23zHg,discussion-id=t2XZaupt,comment-id=0008,timestamp=2018-10-03T06:35:18.959+0000)
>
> Running into the enemy team to die on purpose used be called "feeding," for many years. This season, people started to refer to accidental deaths as feeding, and dying on purpose was called "inting." In the past few months, inting has become another synonym for dying in any context, and the word has been split up into "soft inting" - which just means dying - and "hard inting," which has the same meaning as "feeding" used to have.
> 
> It's kind of like how "awesome" is no longer reserved for things that inspire awe in onlookers, and is used for everything from "my toenail flew straight into the garbage! Awesome!" to "I burned my pizza... awesome."

Did I win something, too?

One day we'll be at ["it was, how you say, dying with malice aforethought."](https://getyarn.io/yarn-clip/c021405e-f497-466e-92ba-489fcd4430f4)

>Did I win something, too?

I was mostly referring to my last line, which called the exact phrase OP used. Minus the "purping" part.
But I sure hope we both won something! Now to wait for the redpost to announce whether it's a car, a vacation or just money.

people shouldnt have to submit support tickets for players to get banned. Riots report system should ban players who intentionally feed and troll. not ban the players who are calling them out for inting and trolling.

I know those people are scum, and their feet should fall off for runing your game... Believe me, I get it.

Getting them banned is the last thing you want though. Let them get to Iron 4. Sure, they will ruin some games getting there. The thing is, the lowest rank in this game is pretty much populated by a few unlucky people, and people trying to get there (like the trolls you encountered). So long as they reach their goal and make it to their intended rank... They can "ruin other trolls games." They can be matched with other players who also want to ruin others games, and the two troll teams can fight it out to see who makes the other team win first... If they get banned, they will make new accounts and start trying to get those accounts demoted to Iron 4 ruining that many more matches in the process.
Maybe they are just really bad, hence Iron 4?

Riot does't care, in fact to prove it a friend of mine inted on an account from silver 2 down to iron 4, he would select mid go smite and follow the jungler around stealing his camps and feed the occasional kills and he would be reported in all games but as long as he doesn't type in chat he never got banned,on the opposite his honor level got improved (the irony),
but if someone flames in chat or decided to open and the others report him he would get banned.
It doesn't make sense, riot needs to work a system that would detect trolls/inters because it's getting frustrating.

RIOT does not care and won't do a thing about it. **They ONLY punish chat, and leaving games.** 

You can report them after the game but that's more to just make you feel like someone cares.
